head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Germany: Auto Parts Company Acquired

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Germany: Auto Parts Company Acquired

abstract.p: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co will take over Auto-Teile Unger, leading car parts retailer in Germany, for 1.45 billion euros ($1.75 million); Auto-Teile is owned by London buyout firm Doughty Hansen & Co (S)

block.p: The private equity firm Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Company will take over Auto-Teile Unger, a leading car parts retailer in Germany, for 1.45 billion euros ($1.75 billion). Owned by a London buyout firm, Doughty Hansen & Company, since 2002, when a bid by Kohlberg Kravis failed, Auto-Teile expanded in Germany and is expected to enter the markets of neighboring countries under Kohlberg Kravis, benefiting from its experience with AutoZone, the leading car parts retailer in the United States. Kohlberg Kravis, which is based in New York, has invested about $8 billion in Europe since December, including two takeovers in Germany.

The private equity firm Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Company will take over Auto-Teile Unger, a leading car parts retailer in Germany, for 1.45 billion euros ($1.75 billion). Owned by a London buyout firm, Doughty Hansen & Company, since 2002, when a bid by Kohlberg Kravis failed, Auto-Teile expanded in Germany and is expected to enter the markets of neighboring countries under Kohlberg Kravis, benefiting from its experience with AutoZone, the leading car parts retailer in the United States. Kohlberg Kravis, which is based in New York, has invested about $8 billion in Europe since December, including two takeovers in Germany.
